alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:16AM EST until January 04 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Monday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Monday was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.1 feet on 06/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued this evening.
